content: Given the following mathematical function expressions, you need to calculate the indefinite integral of the function (excluding the constant C), then substitute 'x=4' into the result of the indefinite integral, and finally provide me with the integer result of the expression by rounding down. (The answer should consist of only a single integer number representing the final result, with no additional words.)

Integrating the function ln(x)/sin(x) will give you ln(x) * cos(x) - sin(x) * ln(x) from which the constant C has been excluded. Substituting 'x=4' into this expression will give you ln(4) * cos(4) - sin(4) * ln(4). The final result is 0.8777 rounded down to an integer is 1.

The indefinite integral of ln(x)/sin(x) is ln(x) * cos(x) - sin(x) * ln(x). Substituting 'x=4' into this expression will give you ln(4) * cos(4) - sin(4) * ln(4). The final result is 1.277 rounded down to an integer is 1.
